p: The species Marsypianthes chamaedrys produces volatile oil rich in sesquiterpene hydrocarbons, principally germacrene D ( 269), bicyclogermacrene ( 264) and β-caryophyllene ( 262) ( Callejon et al., 2016). Another study compares the essential oil produced by Marsypianthes chamaedrys, Marsypianthes burchellii Epling, Marsypianthes foliolosa Benth. and Marsypianthes montana Benth. These species accumulate great amounts of sesquiterpenes, mainly β-caryophyllene ( 262), germacrene D ( 269), caryophyllene oxide ( 284) and spathulenol ( 291) ( Hashimoto et al., 2014).
